author: robocopsgonemad
content: out of curiousity, does anyone know if there are any conventions yet among the L2s for rendering their data into field elements? I'm writing some tests for storing arbitrary text, and i've realized you can't just commit to truly arbitrary data, it has to be massaged a bit to fit into 32 byte field elements. Which can be done a bajillion different ways. Anyone been talking to L2s on this?

author: ralexstokes
content: the straightforward thing is to just partition in 31 bytes and “waste” the extra bits you could squeeze out

author: ralexstokes
content: you can also be smart and pack up to the field modulus

author: ralexstokes
content: as long as the application knows how to interpret the committed data the particular scheme doesn’t really matter

author: robocopsgonemad
content: right, thats my naive implementation: `0x00...31 more bytes of ascii`
